page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN BURSCOUGH 3
page.content:
CANALS The Leeds and Liverpool canal is not used much today except for pleasure craft.But once it was a major route for cargoes of all kinds. Ainscoughs Mill is sited on the canal bank in order to load and unload directly from barges. Top Lock is a group of cottages built around a junction of the canal and it's branch line to the River Ribble at Tarleton.Also at this junction there is a dry dock for repairing craft. Fishermen and walkers regularly use the canal bank and the whole thing is now looked after by British Waterways from their yard in the village centre.
Roads page 14 Railways page 16
